content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

To solve the problem, you would first need to define your struct with FloatWithUnits:

```julia
struct FloatWithUnits
    value::Float64
    unit::String
end
```

Then, write a `show` method for this struct as follows:

```julia
function Base.show(io::IO, fwu::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, "$(fwu.value) $(fwu.unit)")
end
```

This show method takes an IO stream and a FloatWithUnits instance as arguments. It then prints the value and unit of the struct to this stream in the specified format.
